Award.AwardTitle: Social Benefits and Cultural Consequences of Basketball in Rural Alaska
Award.AbstractNarration: The proposed project, graduate researcher Droulias, is an ethnography that will explore the cultural significance of the game of basketball to the community of Nenana in the Interior of Alaska. As the researcher correctly point out Basketball is a significant activity to Alaskan communities and in particular small, rural, primarily Alaska Native, communities. Droulias proposes to examine the extent to which basketball could be a metaphor for community cohesiveness and ultimately a reflection of the social and cultural construction of community itself.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Social Benefits and Cultural Consequences of Basketball in Rural Alaska

Dissertation Improvement Grant, Andreas Droulias, Researcher, Co-PI

David Koester, PI

 

Intellectual Merit

This project contributes to the ethnographic study of Alaskan villages by focusing on a particular social phenomenon that has not been given anthropological attention. It explores the cultural role of basketball in an Alaskan community. 

  1. The anthropology of sports is a growing field and has had little contribution from researchers in the North.  The widespread popularity of basketball and its prominent role in social life is a broadly important social phenomenon in rural Alaska. Several ethnographic studies in Alaska and neighboring Canada have noted the significant social impact basketball has had on small northern communities.  Despite this importance, there has been no focused study on the topic.
  2. This project examines not just athletic competition or spectators’ perspectives, but the integration of both. In addition, it explores the symbolic qualities of the social space that is created by the interaction of players, spectators, the game itself and the gymnasium. The research focuses primarily on a local instance of youth basketball but also adult organized basketball tournaments and “pick up” games.
  3. This research also presents social aspects of sports that reflect the specific circumstances of circumpolar societies.  For instance:
  • In a vast sparsely populated state such as Alaska, basketball provides opportunities to maintain relations among communities.
  • Travelling in Alaska is a unique experience for players and spectators. It renegotiates community solidarity and strengthens inter-individual inter-generational and inter-village relations.

 

Broader impacts

  1. According to the participants in the study, basketball in Alaska has a critical role to play in community life. Residents in rural Alaska face serious sociopathologies such as drug and alcohol abuse, domestic violence and suicide. Children and teenagers are susceptible to all of these, especially suicide. Suicidality, the tendency in a population for suicide to occur, is highly correlated with anomie, lack of integration into society. One of the fundamental questions in societies troubled with suicide is to understand the means and mechanisms of social integration in the group. This study does not directly address the question of suicide. However, all participants in the study, even those critical of the preeminence of basketball in school life, agree that basketball positively influences the children’s and teenagers’ choices and their ability to cope with and face rural Alaska challenges. This study details how basketball facilitates integration into the school and community and gives direction to individual lives and group relations.  
  2. The educative purpose of sports in rural Alaska, cannot be overstressed.  High school basketball, and sports in general in Alaska are perceived by both students and teachers as the most popular way to teach every day values such as respect and hard work.
